intro: Cynanchum volubile, commonly known as climbing milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a perennial vine that produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems that can climb and twine around other vegetation. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly serrated edge. The flowers are followed by distinctive, elongated seed pods that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
